Apple MacBook Pro laptops are considered some of the best in the world - and for good reason.

The newest Pro model offers buyers some seriously good features (some of the most advanced in the market), but it does also come with a hefty price tag (the latest model costs £1,673 from Amazon).

So shopping around for the best deals is essential for any price conscious shoppers out there.

Alternatively if you're happy settling on one of the older models, there are plenty of manufacturer refurbished models on eBay.

The online marketplace has also launched a 20% discount code - POPULAR20 - that can be until 17 October, making your new purchase even cheaper.

Below we've outlined specs and best prices for all the current Macbook Pro models from Apple and major retailers like John Lewis and AO.com.

Best Apple MacBook Pro deals

The newest Macbook Pro features the latest Touch Bar technology and state of the art super sharp Retina display, with a fast Intel Core i7 processor.

The updated keyboard and new Touch Bar functionality offers a smooth and instinctive user experience. Buy now from Apple

This version is identical to its counterpart - only bigger.

This one has more than just a bigger screen, it's packed in with a larger GB capacity, increased RAM and SSD storage. If you're a creative who needs to run lots of powerful programmes and editing suites this machine can deliver fast and efficient loading when you need it most.

2017 Apple MacBook Pro 13", Intel Core i5, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD

This 2017 Pro has various upgrades from the previous model including a new Intel 7th gen i5 processor, making it faster and more efficient.

The razor thin design, enhanced Retina display and 10-hour battery life make this a good investment for someone who wants to invest in a Pro but may not be able to fork out for the very latest model.

2017 Apple MacBook Pro 13", Intel Core i5, 8GB RAM, 128GB SSD

The key difference of this model versus the one above is the storage size. The additional 128GB SSD has a large enough capacity to hold documents, images and more.

Should I buy a refurbished model?

Apple's online certified refurbished outlet is one of the most trusted places to buy second-hand, and prices can be as low as £800.

Amazon, eBay and Laptops Direct are also some of the most popular online retailers to buy secondhand and refurbished MacBooks from.

Most retailers offer a warranty, which can range from 30-days to a year, giving shoppers greater peace of mind.

How much can I save?

This depends on the format of the sale. Is the item refurbished, used, secondhand, or ex-display?

If the item is purchased on auction or second-hand, there's no limit on the amount you can save.

However, if the item is purchased as a certified 'refurbished' device, you're likely to save around a few hundred pounds as it will be classed as almost new.

How to spot the sales before everyone else?

The Apple store occasionally hosts offers, but you'll have to be quick as they sell out in minutes.

KRCS is a premium Apple retailer often offering cheaper prices than rival stores, however they tend to sell the latest Apple devices, rather than older or discontinued models.
